file_content.text: I've made a few calls. The phrase everyone is using is "historical."
This vaccine will get distributed even if I have to hand it out myself.
Remember, once infected, don't scratch. Itching is a sign of your skin coming off to make way for the exoskeleton.
Hmm. Bad news.
The serum you recovered looks like it was effective three hundred years ago, but the rakghoul plague has mutated since then.
This serum will only provide effective immunity for extraordinarily healthy individuals.
No one's going to take an unreliable vaccine.
So it's nearly worthless.
Yes, but it gives us options. Right now I need what we call a "lucky survivor," whose system has antibodies to the modern plague.
Too bad.
Oh, I'm not giving up. Now I just need what we call a "lucky survivor," whose system has made antibodies to the modern plague.
How do we make it stop modern rakghouls?
Can't we improve it somehow?
Manufacturing a true vaccine requires what we call a "lucky survivor," someone whose system has made antibodies to the plague.
We haven't had a survivor yet, for obvious reasons. But this serum might provide the link we need.
If I infected an extraordinary individual protected by the serum, I could collect the antibodies and make an effective vaccine.
If it means we can someday wipe those things from the planet, sign me up.
You could infect me.
What happened to "most virulent disease in known space"?
Would that even work?
Uh-oh.
I need someone with proven recuperative powers. Someone who gets injured almost on a daily basis.
Ideally, they would have survived stabbings, shootings, poison, infections... maybe all of the above.
Or, barring that, someone with conscious control over their bodily processes. Such as a Jedi.
I am well versed in that art. It should be safer for me than others.
I trust my skill.
Selflessness and suicide are not the same thing. I can't agree to this.
Wouldn't work. [Refuse quest]
I understand your profession exposes you to... physical punishment. Do you think you could survive infection?
Doctor... I don't get a chance to save a billion lives every day. I'm in.
This is what I'm here for.
All right, but if I end up as a rakghoul, I want a statue. A non-rakghoul statue.
The Republic better thank me.
Let's, uh, hope it doesn't come to that.
I've been shot more often than the family holocamera. This can't be much worse.
I guess I'm pretty unkillable.
I'm sorry, the galaxy can only hold so much stupid. I'm not contributing.
No. No. No! [Refuse quest]
Death and I have a deal. I don't knock on his door, and he doesn't answer.
Too risky. [Refuse quest]
It would be even better with a large sample size, like an entire crew of people who got shot, stabbed, burned, poisoned... hmm.
Do you all have any plans tonight?
To immunize every Tarisian for generations to come? To recolonize what the Sith destroyed? There is not one of us who wouldn't lay down our lives.
There's no greater cause.
I hoped to convince maybe one of you--but to see more than that is... I'm overwhelmed.
All right. We're your lab animals.
Might as well.
Well... and I had this whole speech ready... all right.
We have a medical droid, CB-08-4, set up to observe rakghouls in the field. He'll be able to collect the antibodies and slow any potential complications.
After I give you the serum, go out there and test it. Let the rakghouls attack you and... see what happens.
Are there any other medical facts I should know?
That's not encouraging!
Uh... sure. You're doing the right thing. Now here's your serum injection.
You don't have this plague in a needle or something?
We're getting bitten?
If it needs to work in the field, it needs to work in the field. Now, here's your serum injection.
Inject us and let's get going.
Get it over with.
Inject me and let's get going.
Get it over with.
Here you go.
I hope the Force is with you, because the science is stretched to the limit.
Come on, we're out of here. My stupidity counter is beeping.
No way! [Refuse quest]
Your fears are... understandable. I will try to find other volunteers.
Welcome back. Let's get those serum samples analyzed and see what we've got.
Well, thank the Force for good Tarisian storage technology. I wasn't sure anything would still be viable after three centuries.
While we wait... is there a cost to these samples I should be aware of? A deal with a pirate crew, perhaps?
There was some unavoidable violence on the way in.
They weren't so cooperative.
Nothing worth mentioning.
No problems. I found some stashed away for a rainy century.
This one's on the ghouls.
You make it sound so easy.
The pirates will be furious, but at me, not you.
I stole it.
I see. I'm not sure I want to know any more details.
Not in front of your people.
I see. Then if it didn't happen in a plastic beaker, don't tell me about it.
They gave it up pretty easily.
[Lie] Nothing to worry about.
Well, that's a pleasant surprise. I guess there's good even in the worst of us sometimes.
Ah, here we are. Fortunately, the plague is so virulent, it cultures very rapidly.
Even if the rakghoul serum samples aren't viable, we might still learn from them.
As you can see by the data, there is no disease in known space that propagates as quickly as the Tarisian rakghoul plague.
Even one individual rakghoul can start a pandemic, as we have observed in eighty-one colonies to date.
Until a vaccine can be widely distributed, it is highly doubtful that any civilian colonization effort will yield lasting results. Thank you.
If you're working on a vaccine, I'd like to help.
Can anything be done?
"Working on" is a generous term. The last breakthrough in rakghoul plague research was three centuries ago.
I didn't know rakghouls had gotten so many colonies.
Grim news.
Rakghouls have been the story on Taris for three centuries.
You lecture like an authority. Should I know your name?
Who are you?
Doctor Ianna Cel, but no one gets famous doing Tarisian rakghoul work. The last breakthrough was three centuries ago.
HoloNet archives say a Doctor Forn developed a "rakghoul serum" vaccine just hours before the bombardment.
I've been trying to acquire this serum, but short of putting a blaster to someone's head, that's not going to happen.
If there's a cure out there, you'd be saving millions.
If it's for a good cause....
Don't tempt me. There's a pirate camp not far from here. I heard they went after the ruins of Sepanik Memorial Hospital.
Something I should know?
There's a pirate camp not far from here. They went after the ruins of Sepanik Memorial Hospital.
You're doing important work. Progress will come.
Cynicism won't help.
As it stands, space pirates have made more progress than I have. They went after the ruins of Sepanik Memorial Hospital.
Sepanik was well preserved. If there's rakghoul serum to be found, it'd be there.
I asked Commander Viqui to step in, but since it wasn't a Republic hospital, the pirates have legal salvage rights.
I'll see what they want in trade for this serum.
I can negotiate with pirates.
Legal and I have parted ways. This planet needs a cure, right?
Don't worry about the law.
What is legal and what is right are often different. I'll pay them a visit.
That cure belongs to everyone.
That's... that's extremely brave of you. The Death's Claw pirate gang robs anything that talks and shoots anything that doesn't.
Commander Viqui has her hands full. I'll handle the pirates.
I'll see about that.
I tune out at archaeology.
Wait--if I go see the pirates, they're going to see "scared human girl with money."
Have you tried approaching them?
Could you buy it off them?
Honestly... no. They're the Death's Claw pirates. They'd look at me and see "scared human girl with money."
You, on the other hand... what would you think about getting some samples out of them?
They'll see reason, or they won't. I'll get your serum.
Pirates are easy.
For a Taris without plague, I'd face much worse.
A worthy cause.
This serum is worth a lot more lives than mine. I'm in.
The Republic needs this.
When you put it that way, it almost sounds glamorous.
But please--be careful. This plague has made enough martyrs.
I speak pirate.
No problem, doctor.
Well, I hope negotiations go well.
I can't say what will be required to get this done, but this plague has infected half a planet's worth of people.
So if that serum shows up on my lab table, it'd be unethical to throw it away for any reason. I hope my position is clear.
Can do.
Thanks.
To have a working vaccine... no price is too high.
That serum probably rotted away before we were born.
Long shot. [Refuse quest]
When you see enough rakghoul victims, you start betting on shadows.
Thanks for listening to the lecture, anyway.
I'm lecturing on xenometamorphic epidemiology. You're welcome to listen.
